Cob:web-Aclevo August '21 update - 05/09/21

We, the Cob:web-Aclevo team have decided that we are going to write short, monthly updates to inform you of important developments and changes happening within the group. This "August update" will be the first in a series of blog posts dedicated to this.

Defining a brand identity and creating brand guidelines for CelOS.

Recently we have decided that we need to set up a brand identity for CelOS. The objective of this would be to define and apply a consistent visual identity to the project, across its different components (Website, installer, GNOME Shell theme, etc.) The issue was first brought about by locness3 who then set out our plan for defining the identity for CelOS.

Define a brand identity:

  • Define our target audience and objectives.
  • Define the scope of the brand identity : website, marketing material and outer desktop UI (GNOME Shell theme)
  • Agree on color and typography guidelines
  • Potentially decide on other guidelines (eg: guidelines for copyrighting)

Next, we would apply the brand identity:

  • Minor redesigns to the website to apply the brand identity and theme.
  • Redesign the Ubiquity slideshow (Installer slideshow) to apply the brand identity and theme.
  • Modify the GNOME Shell theme from default, to use the appropriate colours chosen whilst defining our identity
  • Create a webpage that lays out our brand guidelines

Cob:web-Aclevo is proudly supported by Fosshost.org
